alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing valine or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of valine at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Valine and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Amide derivatives of alpha amino acids.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha amino acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a fatty acid moiety linked to an amine group through an ester linkage.
alternative_parents.name: N-acyl amines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary carboxylic acid amide functional group, with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')H (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds  in which a carbonyl group is bonded to two carbon atoms R2C=O (neither R may be a hydrogen atom). Ketones that have one or more alpha-hydrogen atoms undergo keto-enol tautomerization, the tautomer being an enol.
alternative_parents.name: Ketones

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid derivatives in which the carbon atom from the carbonyl group is attached to an alkyl or an aryl moiety through an oxygen atom (forming an ester group).
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds a sulfenyl group with the general formula RS (R = organyl).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfenyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds containing a thioether group that is substituted by two alkyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkylthioethers

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an primary aliphatic amine group.
alternative_parents.name: Monoalkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Lipids synthesized from the five-carbon-unit precursors isopentenyl diphosphate and dimethylallyl diphosphate.
class.name: Prenol lipids

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as pleuromutilin and derivatives. These are mutilins with a hydroxyacetate derivative attached to the C8 carbon atom of the cyclopenta[8]annulene moiety.

direct_parent.description: Mutilins with a hydroxyacetate derivative attached to the C8 carbon atom of the cyclopenta[8]annulene moiety.
direct_parent.name: Pleuromutilin and derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Diterpenoids with a structure based on the mutilane skeleton.
intermediate_nodes.name: Mutilane diterpenoids

intermediate_nodes.description: Tricyclic diterpenoids structurally characterized by the presence of a 1-oxo-decahydro-3a,9-propanocyclopenta[8]annulene skeleton.
intermediate_nodes.name: Mutilin derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Terpene compounds formed by four isoprene units.
subclass.name: Diterpenoids

superclass.description: Fatty acids and their derivatives, and substances related biosynthetically or functionally to these compounds.
superclass.name: Lipids and lipid-like molecules
